title: BNP sweeps Bangladesh election: What's next for Muhammad Yunus?
content: Bangladesh's Nationalist Party has secured a decisive victory, paving the way for Tarique Rahman as prime minister. Nobel laureate Muhammad Yunus, who led the interim government after a 2024 uprising, is expected to step down. His tenure focused on restoring order and implementing reforms, but the incoming government will face challenges of political polarization and foreign policy recalibration.

title: Market crash: Investors lose Rs 9.5L cr in just two days!
content: The overall market capitalization of companies listed on the BSE shrank by Rs 7,02,017.71 crore, bringing the total valuation down to Rs 4,65,46,643.20 crore ($5.13 trillion). In the last two trading sessions investors have lost Rs 9.5 lakh crore.

title: 'When India re-wrote its fate': PM Modi on Seva Teerth, Kartavya Bhawans
content: ‚ÄãThe Prime Minister said the newly inaugurated buildings reflect India‚Äôs commitment to citizen-centric governance and national progress. "Today we all are witnessing a new history being made... This day of 13th February is witnessing a new beginning in India's development journey... Today, we are all entering Seva Teerth and Kartavya Bhavan with the resolve to achieve 'Viksit Bharat'. We have the divine blessings of achieving our goals," he said.

title: Kapil, Dhoni‚Ä¶ Surya? How Zimbabwe's victories over Aus have an India connection
content: Zimbabwe secured a significant 23-run victory over Australia in the T20 World Cup, marking their second-ever win against the former champions in this format. This historic upset echoes past tournaments where Zimbabwe's triumph over Australia preceded an Indian World Cup title win, adding an intriguing historical parallel to the current event.

title: What 1500 Amazon engineers told company's leadership over forced use of coding tool?
content: Amazon engineers are pushing back against a company policy favoring its AI coding assistant, Kiro, over superior third-party tools like Claude Code.  Around 1,500 engineers have formally backed Claude Code, citing productivity concerns and questioning how sales teams can promote AWS Bedrock while restricted from using its offerings. This internal dissent highlights a growing demand for better AI tools.

title: T20 World Cup: Five-star Junaid Siddique, Aryansh Sharma fire UAE to first win
content: UAE secured their first T20 World Cup win, defeating Canada by six wickets. Junaid Siddique's five-wicket haul restricted Canada to a modest total, while Aryansh Sharma and Sohaib Khan's crucial partnership guided UAE to a successful chase. The duo's aggressive batting in the death overs sealed the victory.

title: Happy Valentine‚Äôs Day 2026: Wishes, messages, images, status and captions
content: Valentine's Week has arrived, transforming markets and social media with romantic gestures. Beyond grand displays, the article emphasizes the power of sincere messages, offering heartfelt, playful, and subtle ideas for expressing love, appreciation, and self-care. It highlights that genuine connection and thoughtful expression are what truly matter during this time.

title: After CEO asked employees to stop coding, Nvidia engineers get access to OpenAI's Codex
content: Nvidia has deployed OpenAI's Codex AI coding tool to all 30,000 engineers, marking a significant enterprise rollout. CEO Jensen Huang's mandate to automate tasks with AI is driving this adoption, with engineers praising the tool's ability to handle complex workflows and maintain context.

title: Aus down, but not out? Travis Head points to 2023 ODI WC comeback blueprint
content: Zimbabwe secured a significant victory over Australia in the T20 World Cup. They posted 169 runs and successfully defended the total. Australia's captain Travis Head remained optimistic, referencing their 2023 ODI World Cup comeback. Injuries have also affected Australia's squad. This marks a rare World Cup absence of key pacers Cummins, Hazlewood, and Starc together.

title: India's Hasina dilemma: Resurgent BNP seeks extradition - what are New Delhi's options?
content: As Bangladesh's new government, led by the BNP, takes charge of country's affair, it has called on India for the extradition of ousted former prime minister Sheikh Hasina, who is in New Delhi. This demand presents a significant diplomatic challenge for India. Dhaka says, it seeks a relationship based on equality and mutual respect, with border security and water sharing also key issues.

title: Cisco president Jeetu Patel says company will never hire these developers
content: Cisco's president Jeetu Patel mandates AI for all developers, aiming for half a dozen AI-coded products by 2026. This shift to spec-driven development sees human teams shrink, with AI agents tripling output. While embracing AI's potential, Cisco is investing heavily in security to prevent rogue agents, urging developers to master AI to stay relevant.

title: Lauren Kyle turns heads in Milan as Connor McDavid eyes opener
content: Connor McDavid and Team Canada have arrived in Milan for the 2026 Winter Olympics, beginning preparations for their opener against Czechia. McDavid skated on the top line in practice and shared candid remarks about the Olympic Village and adjusting to jet lag. Off the ice, Lauren Kyle‚Äôs Instagram posts offered fans a personal look at life in Milan, highlighting family support and national pride. Canada, led by captain Sidney Crosby, aims to build on last year‚Äôs international success as Olympic competition begins.

title: Bad Bunny, Kendall Jenner spark buzz after Super Bowl LX show
content: Supermodel and Bad Bunny's ex girlfriend, Kendall Jenner, was spotted at Super Bowl LX as the popular Grammy winner took the stage for his controversial record breaking performance at the halftime show. Soon after the show, rumors of the two rekindling their romance have sparked chaos. Amid this, a clip of two leaving in his luxurious car has sparked panic as many believe the two have got back together.

title: Mavericks vs Lakers injury report: Who‚Äôs playing, out and questionable
content: The Dallas Mavericks and Los Angeles Lakers face off with significant injury concerns impacting both teams. Key players like Cooper Flagg for Dallas and Luka Donƒçiƒá and Deandre Ayton for the Lakers are sidelined. Despite absences, the Lakers, led by LeBron James, are favored at home, while Dallas aims to stay in the playoff hunt.

title: Rohit Shetty makes first public appearance with son amid heavy security at Mumbai airport
content: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport following a firing incident outside his residence. Accompanied by heavy security, he was seen bidding an emotional farewell to his son. The sighting comes after reports of gunshots near his home, leading to an ongoing investigation and increased security measures in the area.

title: 2,842 Gazans vaporised by thermobaric bombs? All about shocking weapon 'used' by Israel
content: Thousands of Palestinians have reportedly gone missing in Gaza since October 2023, with Civil Defense teams documenting at least 2,842 disappearances. Military experts suggest the use of high-temperature weapons, like thermobaric munitions, may be responsible for the extreme incineration of human tissue, leaving only biological traces.

title: Josh Morrissey doubtful for Switzerland as injury update remains unclear
content: Team Canada is in limbo following the team's defenseman, Josh Morrissey, who left the Olympic match against Team Czechia with an unexplained injury. There was no obvious update given by head coach Jon Cooper, and the question arises concerning the availability of Morrissey in the next game against Team Switzerland. The state of affairs can also affect the defensive pairings when Canada is gearing towards its next vital Olympic competition.

title: B'desh polls: PM Modi dials BNP's Tarique Rahman, hails 'remarkable victory'
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Tarique Rahman on the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's decisive election victory, reaffirming India's commitment to close bilateral ties. Rahman, son of BNP founder Ziaur Rahman, is expected to become prime minister following the party's significant win, ushering in potential political stability.

title: Draft I-T rules 2026 explained: How you can save Rs 1.41 lakh tax outgo
content: What do the draft income tax rules mean for the common man? How does the calculation math for the old vs new income tax regime change? How much more tax can you now save under the old regime with revised exemption and deduction limits? Here are the top changes taxpayers should know:

title: Lakhpati Didis, farmers & start-ups: Details of first files signed by PM Modi at new office
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi signed a series of files from his new office complex, Seva Teerth. He approved a series of decisions focusing on women, youth, farmers and vulnerable citizens. According to the government, the first decisions from Seva Teerth reflect a spirit of ‚ÄúSeva‚Äù and aim to touch every section of society.

title: China sees red as CIA releases video appealing to potential PLA spies
content: The CIA's new Chinese-language recruitment video, targeting China's military, has sparked outrage in Beijing. The clip depicts a PLA officer disillusioned by corruption, a theme echoed by recent purges of top generals. China vows "all necessary measures" against foreign espionage, escalating intelligence rivalry amid US efforts to rebuild its China network.

title: Hit, treat, repeat: Thailand cricketer bleeds to perfect idol SKY's 'Supla' shot
content: Thailand cricketer Natthakan Chantham is diligently practicing Suryakumar Yadav's signature 'Supla shot', enduring numerous hits in her pursuit of mastering the stroke.  She aims to showcase this fearless batting style, inspired by Yadav, at the upcoming ACC Women‚Äôs Asia Cup Rising Stars 2026 in Bangkok.

title: Palash Muchhal gets relief from Bombay HC in defamation case against Vidnyan Mane
content: Singer Palash Muchhal received interim relief from the Bombay High Court against Vidnyan Mane, who made explosive allegations about Muchhal's cancelled wedding to Smriti Mandhana. The court restrained Mane from publishing further statements, citing potential reputational damage. Mane had accused Muchhal of infidelity and financial fraud, claims Muchhal has vehemently denied.

title: Sensex down over 1,000 points - top 5 reasons for fall
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the equity benchmarks, crashed in trade on Friday amid weak global cues and the continued IT stocks selloff. While Nifty50 went below 25,600, BSE Sensex was down over 700 points.

title: Marvel Rivals Season 6.5 release timings for all regions
content: Marvel Rivals gears up for its major mid-season update, Season 6.5, launching February 13, 2026. The highly anticipated addition is Elsa Bloodstone, the 47th playable hero and a new Duelist. This update also promises significant meta-shifting balance changes and a Valentine's Day celebration, enhancing the hero shooter experience for players worldwide.

title: Man collapses, dies at TVK chief Vijay's rally in Tamil Nadu's Salem
content: A 37-year-old guest worker from Maharashtra, Siraj, tragically passed away during a political meeting in Salem. He had been living in the city for two decades with his family and was known for making silver rings and working in construction.

title: Why Nehru recognised Tibet as a part of China ‚Äî CDS Anil Chauhan explains
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan stated that Jawaharlal Nehru recognized Tibet as part of China to foster a strong relationship, recalling the Panchsheel agreement. He emphasized that India must reconsider its perspective on Himalayan boundaries, particularly in Uttarakhand's middle sector, where the Himalayas have historically served as interaction zones.

title: ‚ÄòIf he pauses...‚Äô: Ashwin‚Äôs fascinating advice to India before Usman Tariq test
content: Ravichandran Ashwin has devised a clever strategy for India's batters facing Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq. Ashwin suggests batters can leverage the rules by stepping away if Tariq pauses during his run-up, potentially unsettling the bowler and shifting pressure. He also highlighted the difficulty umpires face in judging Tariq's action in real-time, advocating for better technology.

title: Ankur Warikoo shares 5 green flags and 3 red flags of a toxic workplace
content: Entrepreneur Ankur Warikoo identified five green flags for healthy workplaces, including respect, acknowledgement, fair rewards, growth, and mentorship. He also warned of three red flags: dreading work, enduring long hours for minimal pay, and a dismissive "be grateful" attitude. Warikoo emphasizes that a good job challenges without breaking you, urging readers to seek environments that uplift.

title: Mafia don Mukhtar Ansari‚Äôs shooter Shoaib Kidwai shot dead in UP's Barabanki
content: A close associate of slain mafia don Mukhtar Ansari, Shoaib Kidwai alias Bobby, was shot dead in broad daylight in Barabanki. Motorcycle-borne assailants intercepted his car and fired over ten rounds. Police are scanning CCTV footage and have launched combing operations, suspecting gang rivalry as the motive.

title: PMO has a new address: PM Modi unveils ‚ÄòSeva Teerth‚Äô ‚Äî what are the key changes
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated 'Seva Teerth', a new building complex housing the PMO, National Security Council Secretariat, and Cabinet Secretariat, alongside Kartavya Bhavan 1 and 2. This significant administrative overhaul consolidates key government functions into modern, efficient, and citizen-centric facilities, replacing colonial-era nomenclature with names reflecting public service and duty.

title: Reliance bags US licence to buy Venezuela oil; may help replace Russian crude: Report
content: This general licence permits the acquisition, export, and sale of oil sourced from Venezuela that has already been produced, as well as its refining. Reliance had submitted its licence application in early January.

title: Pirated DVDs of Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' being sold at a shocking price in Pakistan
content: Despite being banned in Pakistan and some Gulf nations, Ranveer Singh's 'Dhurandhar' has found an audience through streaming and pirated DVDs in Pakistan. A YouTuber documented the film being openly sold for a mere PKR 50 in Karachi's grey markets, highlighting the demand for Indian cinema.

title: Bike first, crowd next: Speeding car leaves trail of destruction in Lucknow‚Äî CCTV shows horror
content: A speeding car driven by a 21-year-old student ran over six pedestrians near Hanuman Temple in Lucknow's Banthra area, killing a six-year-old boy. The accused, Gaurav Singh, was arrested within hours based on CCTV footage after he attempted to flee the scene. The vehicle, registered in Kanpur, has been seized.

title: Shock in Colombo! Zimbabwe stun Aussies as Muzarabani, Bennett script T20 WC classic
content: Zimbabwe secured a significant upset in the ICC T20 World Cup 2026, defeating Australia by 23 runs. A composed batting effort led by Brian Bennett's unbeaten 64, followed by a dominant bowling display spearheaded by Blessing Muzarabani's 4/17, proved decisive. This victory, their second against Australia in the format, has dramatically opened up Group B.

title: Bowling shake-up vs Pak? Gavaskar hints at big India change for T20 WC showdown
content: Former captain Sunil Gavaskar suggests a tactical shift for India's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan, hinting at Kuldeep Yadav replacing Arshdeep Singh. Gavaskar noted Arshdeep's incomplete overs and Sri Lankan pitches favoring spinners as reasons for this potential change. He also commented on Sanju Samson's batting, identifying a technical flaw.

title: Answering key offseason questions for every NFL team: Intel on free agency, QB decisions and draft options
content: Which teams will make a splash move? Which teams must make adjustments? We answered big offseason questions.

title: Pats' Diggs pleads not guilty to assault allegation
content: Patriots wide receiver Stefon Diggs on Friday pleaded not guilty to felony strangulation and other criminal charges stemming from an alleged dispute with his personal chef.

title: ISU defends ice dance scoring amid controversy
content: The ISU is standing by the judging of ice dance at the Winter Olympics, where the scores from the French judge played a role in the French team of Laurence Fournier Beaudry and Guillaume Cizeron beating the American team of Madison Chock and Evan Bates.

title: Big Ten eyes 24-team CFP, no league title games
content: The Big Ten is circulating an internal document that lays out what a 24-team CFP would look like, including the elimination of conference championship games, a 23-plus-one selection model and an additional weekend of on-campus CFP home games.

title: LeBron oldest with triple-double in NBA history
content: LeBron James broke a record held by Karl Malone by posting a triple-double in the Lakers' win over the Mavericks.

title: Klaebo ties all-time Winter Olympics gold record
content: Norway's Johannes Hosflot Klaebo has won an eighth career gold medal in cross-country skiing at the Milan Cortina Olympics, tying the all‚Äëtime Winter Games record.

title: Longtime fugitive nabbed trying to attend Games
content: A Slovak fugitive who had been on the run for 16 years was finally arrested when he turned up in Milan to support his national ice hockey team at the Milan Cortina Winter Olympics, police said.

title: Ukrainian: 'Train has left' as helmet appeal heard
content: The Court of Arbitration for Sport heard the appeal of Ukrainian skeleton athlete Vladyslav Heraskevych surrounding his disqualification from the Milan Cortina Games, though the slider knows he won't be competing even if he wins his case.

title: Trump pardons include Klecko, Newton, Lewis
content: President Donald Trump on Thursday pardoned former NFL players Joe Klecko, Nate Newton, Jamal Lewis, Travis Henry and the late Billy Cannon on Thursday.

content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts, earned the pole Wednesday with a lap at 183.925 mph.

content: We'll see 32 picks in Round 1, but which prospects have actually earned a first-round grade? There are currently 11 in the 2026 class. Here's the updated list.

content: The Philadelphia Phillies have released outfielder Nick Castellanos, making him a free agent who can sign with any club for the league minimum.

content: Who's the Premier League's fastest player? The slowest? Best passer? The worst? And more. Here are 25 superlatives from different skills.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea, Man United eye UCL standout Stankovic
content: Arsenal, Chelsea and Manchester United are all monitoring Club Brugge midfielder Aleksandar Stankovic. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Scripted Posts, Late-Night Calls: How A 'Rescue Op' Saved UK PM Starmer's Job
content: For now, Keir Starmer has bought time, but heads sans party loyalty. His authority rests on temporary endorsements and managed optics.

title: Exclusive: In Macron's Return To India, Defence, AI And People At Core Of Familiar Partnership
content: French President Emmanuel Macron begins his three-day visit to India on February 17 with a schedule that mixes remembrance, business, technology and geopolitics, an itinerary designed to underline how far the India-France relationship travelled.

title: Bill Gates, Tony Blair, And Sundar Pichai Among Key Attendees At India AI Summit
content: India's first-ever Artificial Intelligence Impact Summit is scheduled in New Delhi's Bharat Mandapam from February 16 to 20, bringing together global leaders, innovators and policymakers.

title: Imran Khan To Be Shifted To New Jail With Medical Facilities: Pak Minister
content: Pakistan's Interior Minister Mohsin Naqvi told the media on Friday that the former prime minister of the country, Imran Khan, will be transferred to the new Islamabad jail once the facility is fully constructed within the next two months.

title: UP Man Beaten To Death By Cop, Others For Objecting To People Urinating Near House
content: A 45-year-old man was allegedly beaten to death after he objected to some wedding guests urinating near his house in the Naini area of Prayagraj district, police said on Friday, adding that six of the 12 named accused have been arrested.

title: Air India Flew Plane 8 Times Without Airworthiness Permit, Fined Rs 1 Crore
content: In its order imposing the fine, the DGCA observed that the Airbus A320 aircraft was flown on multiple sectors, including flights connecting New Delhi, Bengaluru, Mumbai and Hyderabad.

title: 'Godman', Poison Laddoo, 'Djinn' Ritual: How Delhi Triple Murder Was Executed
content: From poison-laced laddoos to claims involving Djinns (supernatural beings), each new revelation has added another disturbing layer to the triple murder case in Delhi's Peeragarhi.

title: RERA In Trouble? Why Supreme Court Warned It Can Be Shut Down
content: The Supreme Court issued a scathing remark on the Real Estate Regulatory Authority (RERA) on Thursday. Chief Justice Surya Kant said RERA has accomplished nothing concrete beyond providing benefits to defaulting builders.

title: On Camera, Speeding Sports Bike Hits Doctor In Uttarakhand, Rider Flees
content: A senior physician, Dr Harbhajan Singh, was seriously injured late at night in Uttarakhand's Haldwani district after being struck by a speeding biker.

title: 97% Flyers' Complaints Addressed, Says Centre. Explain How, Says Shashi Tharoor
content: The Ministry of Civil Aviation has informed parliament that nearly 97 per cent of passenger grievances have been addressed since the operationalisation of a dedicated 24x7 passenger assistance control room (PACR).

title: 6 Bengaluru Students Sneak Out For Joyride, None Survive Horrific Crash
content: The tragedy occurred on the Hoskote-Dabaspete National Highway when a speeding Mahindra XUV 700, with a group of students on an early morning joyride, triggered a chain collision involving a motorcycle and a Canter truck.

title: How Jaish And Lashkar Are Gaining Ground By Recruiting Women
content: Pakistan-based terror groups Jaish-e-Mohammad (JeM) and Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) are amplifying their influence through women's networks to disseminate radical ideologies.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Bangladesh Polls: What Are Jamaat And Yunus Planning Next?
content: Yunus's motivations across the board indicate that he's not likely to be 'retiring' soon. This election is a quiet - and overlooked - win for the Jamaat, too.

title: Row Over LDF Campaign Poster On Oommen Chandy's Tomb, Cops Check CCTV
content: A political controversy erupted after a poster of the LDF election campaign was found pasted on the tomb of former chief minister Oommen Chandy.

title: AIADMK's "Carry Coffin" Jab As Man Dies Hours After Attending Vijay's Rally
content: A man who attended a rally of actor and TVK chief Vijay in Tamil Nadu's Salem died in hospital of a heart attack, a local administration official said.

title: Andhra Techie, 32, Killed After Container Topples Onto Car
content: A-32-year-old software engineer lost his life in a tragic road accident on Thursday when a heavy container toppled onto his car at a busy junction on the outskirts of Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district.

title: On Camera, Midair Explosion Leaves Jet Engine Shredded, Passengers Terrified
content: A commercial passenger flight operated by Arik Air made an emergency landing in southern Nigeria after one of its engines exploded, causing severe damage, according to officials and safety reports.

title: Seva Teerth Inauguration: PM Narendra Modi Unveils Rs 100 Commemorative Coin
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated Seva Teerth and Kartavya Bhavan 1 and 2 in the national capital on Friday, February 13.

title: New Ukrainian Laser System Takes Out Enemy Drones Without Sound Or Light
content: Ukraine has reportedly developed a silent air defence system capable of taking out Russian drones mid-air with almost no sound or visible trace.

title: As New Delhi turns 95, PMO shifts to Seva Teerth: City's layered past shapes its legacy
content: new Delhi turned 95 today, a milestone that binds two moments of power separated by nearly a century . in 1931, the British formally inaugurated New Delhi as the imperial capital . ninety-five years later, prime minister Narendra Modi marked a symbolic departure from that legacy by shifting the Prime Minister‚Äôs Office from South Block to 'Seva Teerth'

content: The allegations linking it to the ghee supplied by the Maharashtra-based dairy to the TTD are completely unfounded and have no connection to the company, clarifies Heritage Foods COO

content: The Musi Riverfront Development Corporation Limited has issued a notification for land to be acquired  ‚Äî 9.2 kilometre stretch between Himayatsagar and Gandhi Sarovar and the 11.8 kilometre stretch between Osmansagar and Gandhi Sarovar

content: Ministry says its advice to the KRDCL to revise the DPR in line with the latest technical standards to integrate it with the existing network, but the suggestion has not been heeded

content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy told that the tourism development corporation will stop purchasing petrol motor boats

content: Booth Level officers (BLOs) have completed around 70% of mapping of names till now, says Satish Jarkiholi

content: IMA demands that small and medium hospitals in Kerala be exempted from within the purview of the Kerala Clinical Establishments (KCE) Act so that the common public can continue to access affordable and quality health care.

title: UFC at the White House explained
content: the event will be the first live professional sporting event on the white house on June 14 . it will be simulcast on CBS and Paramount+ . the announcement of which fighters will compete will continue as the date draws closer . white has credited the president with the idea to stage fights at the nation's capital .

title: Multi-pronged strategy to curb cybercrime in State, says Home Minister Anitha
content: Awareness campaigns on emerging trends and reporting mechanism, prompt action through cyber helpline, and capacity building of police personnel among the measures being taken, says the Home Minister

title: Special Intensive Revision drawing to a close in Kerala, hearings over in 122 Assembly constituencies
content: So far, 39,297 individuals have been excluded from the voter roll after hearings, says Chief Electoral Officer (Kerala) Rathan U. Kelkar. The hearings in the remaining constituencies are expected to be completed by Saturday

title: Suresh Gopi to inaugurate new multi-level car parking at Kollam railway station
content: The facility‚Äôs strategic location near the Puthiyakavu temple provides quick access to the highway, and its position adjacent to the railway station ensures seamless and convenient access to all users

title: Various hydel tourism projects launched in Idukki
content: Electricity Minister inaugurates Vadakkepuzha tourism project, Kulamavu dam mini-park, formal handover of land for a miniature model of the Moolamattom powerhouse, and virtually lays foundation stone for a laser show project at the Idukki arch dam

title: No decision yet on SSUS-KCA cricket stadium project, say varsity authorities
content: A Syndicate meeting held on December 19, 2025, had discussed the revised master plan for the project that envisaged setting up the cricket stadium and allied infrastructure on six acres on the main campus of the Sree Sankaracharya University of Sanskrit at Kalady

title: All transfers are to be made in public interest: Government on High Court judges' transfers
content: ‚ÄúAs per Memorandum of Procedure (MoP) for appointment and transfer of High Court judges, proposal for transfer is initiated by Chief Justice of India in consultation with four senior-most judges of Supreme Court,‚Äù says Law Minister

title: Seva Teerth, Kartavya Bhawan are important milestone in India‚Äôs journey towards Viksit Bharat, PM Modi says
content: The prime minister said the historic structures such as the South Block and North Block, which till now house important ministries besides the PMO, were built to embody the ideals of the British Empire

title: Experts underscore the importance of extracting only relevant data
content: We need to be aware of why a website is seeking a particular piece of data and the purpose. Members of the public should be conscious of the data that they are giving, says A.N. Srinivasan, senior vice-president-IT, SRF Ltd.

title: Mahasivaratri: Collector reviews arrangements at Srisailam temple
content: G. Rajakumari instructs officials to ensure uninterrupted drinking water, maintain strict hygiene standards, and strengthen coordination among departments to prevent inconvenience to devotees

title: Yuva Morch stages protest march to GCDA office against alleged backdoor recruitment
content: Thousands of candidates in PSC rank lists are being betrayed by the government, says Yuva Morcha State president

title: YSRCP accuses govt. of misleading House on fee reimbursement dues
content: HRD Minister Lokesh‚Äôs claim that thousands of crores have been left unpaid by the previous government is untrue, says Botcha Satyanarayana

title: As Kerala‚Äôs youngest organ donor, 10-month-old baby Aalin Sherin Abraham to save four lives
content: The infant was declared declared brain-dead on February 13 after being admitted in a critical condition at a private hospital in Kochi following a road accident

title: Kerala Cabinet approves graphene policy
content: Graphene and its derivatives have a wide range of applications spanning electronics, composites, energy storage, water filtering, sensors, and packaging

title: Security tightened at Srisailam for Mahasivaratri Brahmotsavams
content: A total of 1,614 police personnel from Kurnool, Anantapur, Annamayya, and Kadapa districts deployed, including 11 ASPs, 24 DSPs, 78 Circle Inspectors, 132 Sub-Inspectors, 303 ASIs and Head Constables, 568 Police Constables, 88 Women Police Constables, 386 Home Guards, and 30 Women Home Guards

title: MPs from Karnataka meet the finance minister on impact of SARFAESI Act on planters
content: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has instructed banks to stop the e-auction of coffee estates under SARFAESI Act, according to KGF

title: Kerala Gen Z redefining Valentine‚Äôs Day as trululu
content: Many young adults are redefining what Valentine‚Äôs Day means, often re-branding it as an inclusive celebration of all kinds of love that prioritises platonic friendships over traditional dating

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today
content: Welcome to the Karnataka Today newsletter, your guide from The Hindu on the major news stories to follow today. Curated and written by Nalme Nachiyar.

content: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) had initiated the probe into the alleged money laundering case based on an FIR filed by the Pune unit of the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB)

content: Water Resources Minister dismisses rumours of instability in KC(M), says he will contest the Assembly election from Idukki

title: Liquor crackdown and infrastructure projects discussed in A.P. Assembly
content: 191 persons arrested in adulterated liquor cases; ‚Çπ72-crore bridge across Vamsadhara to be ready by December; 10 modern fishing harbours being developed in State

content: ‚ÄòThe present competitive era and opportunities in the judicial system are increasing exponentially and success will be certain only with continuous study and hard work‚Äô

title: ‚Çπ10 crore Central aid at stake as Mysuru print cluster awaits land allotment
content: Delegation meets DC with an appeal to expedite land allotment to the long-pending cluster project for which 7.8 acres of land have been set aside in Koorgalli by KIADB

title: Higher education has no limits, says Kerala Governor
content: Delivering the inaugural address at the Sreenarayana Guru Open University‚Äôs first ever convocation ceremony, Rajendra Vishwanath Arlekar said the higher education sector must serve as a pillar for nation-building

title: BJP received 82% of ‚Çπ3,826 crore donated by electoral trusts in 2024-25: ADR
content: The Indian National Congress (INC) received ‚Çπ298.78 crore or 7.81%, while the Trinamool Congress got ‚Çπ102 crore (2.67%). Nineteen other parties together received ‚Çπ267.92 crore

title: ED attaches ‚Çπ100 crore assets of firms linked with West Bengal coal 'scam'
content: The ED said a provisional order has been issued under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) to attach immovable properties, fixed deposits, and mutual funds of "beneficiary" companies linked to this case ‚Äî Shakambhari Ispat and Power Ltd and Gagan Ferrotech Ltd.

title: Govt. approves 25 lakh tonnes of wheat exports
content: As of April 1, 2026, the total wheat availability in the central pool with Food Corporation of India (FCI) is projected at around 182 lakh tonne

title: Linking TTD ghee row with Heritage an attempt to malign my family reputation, says Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: Certain media outlets published false stories targeting the brand in a bid to weaken the family-run business financially, he alleges

title: Mahua Moitra alleges Amit Malviya intervened in executing court warrant by West Bengal police in Noida
content: The police in West Bengal‚Äôs Nadia district also alleged that their attempt to arrest the accused was obstructed, following which the individual managed to flee

title: Kerala becomes first State to have an urban policy
content: State Cabinet approves the draft policy prepared by the Local Self-Government department. The government had announced the policy in the State Budget for 2023-24

title: Watch: PM Narendra Modi inaugurates new PMO complex Seva Teerth in New Delhi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has inaugurated the new Prime Minister‚Äôs Office complex, Seva Teerth, in New Delhi, marking a major administrative shift. The PMO, along with the Cabinet Secretariat and National Security Council Secretariat, will now function under one roof.

title: ‚ÄòPennum Porattum‚Äô movie review: An absurdist satire that just escapes getting lost in its chaos
content: In Pennum Porattum, Rajesh Madhavan makes his bold directorial debut, capturing the rollercoaster human behaviour with a blend of quirky humor and absurd situations

title: Crimes committed under the guise of politics will not be tolerated, warns Chief Minister Chandrababu Naidu
content: The government will act tough against those attempting to disrupt peace or undermine public institutions, asserts the Chief Minister, and reiterates that there will be no power tariff hike for the next three years

title: Woman police constable injured in accident involving TVK cadre‚Äôs bike in Salem
content: Near Kamalapuram on the Salem‚ÄìBengaluru National Highway, four cadres who were riding motorcycles reportedly hit a woman constable on duty, causing her to fall on the road. She sustained minor injuries during the incident.

title: Bill Gates to visit Andhra Pradesh on¬†February 16
content: The State will create digital health records and provide personalised medicines, with the support of the Gates Foundation, says Chief Minister Naidu

title: Weekend preview: Ronaldo's return; Inter-Juve in to decide title?
content: the "Futbol Americas" crew discuss weston McKennie's recent form for the club . this week, we take you to England , Scotland , Spain , Italy , France and even Saudi Arabia for a big derby, some Cup magic and new managers galore . the team are currently fourth in the premier league, with a record 4th manager of season .

title: Power Rankings: Same top 4, different order -- including No. 1
content: the top seven teams in last week's Power Rankings went 8-7 in the span of seven days, with Michigan accounting for three of those wins . four of the top five playing road games against other ranked teams between editions . all four of those teams lost: UConn to St. John's on Friday; Duke at the buzzer to North Carolina on Saturday; Illinois in overtime to Michigan State on Sunday; and Arizona .

title: College baseball 2026: Top storylines, POY picks and MCWS predictions
content: our college baseball experts break it all down, plus give some way-too-early predictions for the end of the year . we've got a slew of new head coaches at top programs looking to make their marks early on, like Josh Elander at Tennessee and Chris Pollard at Virginia .

title: WNBA mock draft: Who follows Azzi Fudd at No. 1?
content: the WNBA and players' association continue negotiating a new collective bargaining agreement . most players not under rookie contracts are free agents, plus there are two expansion teams that don't have any players yet . we are projecting draft selections without important context about the players they will be joining .

title: Way-Too-Early All-America team: Forecasting college football's top players in 2026
content: the Longhorns finished 10-3 last season and missed the college football Playoff . the 2026 Way-Too-Early All-America team is a tough position to pick just one player . quarterback arch Manning, receiver Cam Coleman and linebackers Colin Simmons and Rasheem Biles are on the team .

title: Opening-game onslaught: Grades, top players, key questions from Team USA's win over Latvia
content: team USA has won its opening game in the 2026 men's ice hockey tournament . it upended Latvia by a final score of 5-1 . the first period included two successful coach's challenges from Latvia . there are certain players every team must rely on if it's going to win .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate a team's underlying potential .

title: Megan Grant's double life: How UCLA's softball star decided to join the basketball program
content: MEGAN GRANT has a career .727 slugging percentage, .978 fielding percentage and earned the Big Ten single-season record for home runs with 26 in 2025 . the senior softball star will have weight training, class and softball practice before putting on her jersey .

title: Chloe Kim falls short of snowboarding history and more
content: American snowboarder Chloe Kim fell just short of history at the Winter Olympics on Thursday. Kim, who was trying to become the first snowboarder to win three straight Olympic gold medals with a victory in the women's halfpipe final, looked to be well on track after an 88.00 in her first run. A fall in her second run left her vulnerable, however, and 17-year-old South Korean Choi Ga-on took advantage, scoring a 90.25 in her third run. Kim was unable to overcome that deficit, falling in her third run. The preliminary round for men's ice hockey began with the U.S. and Canada among countries in action. The U.S. team hasn't won gold in men's Olympic hockey since 1980, but this year it's gold medal or bust. "That's the expectation," captain Auston Matthews  said . Both the U.S. and Canada got started on the right foot in their openers, winning 5-1 and 5-0, respectively. MORE:   Medal tracker  |  Full schedule of events  |  Olympics 101 Below are the top moments from Thursday's events.

title: Olympics men's hockey daily: Finland upends Sweden, Canada-Switzerland on tap
